news.title: A Remote LSAT is Scheduled for May Because of Coronavirus
news.description: The Law School Admission Council plans to administer a remotely proctored LSAT examination for students who had registered for March and April tests that were cancelled.

news.title: Practical Steps to Keep Your Firm Running in a Pandemic (and Beyond)
news.description: Many remote practice solutions that attorneys have increasingly been utilizing because of the COVID-19 outbreak can help them increase their efficiency and effectiveness in the long run.

news.title: ABA Board of Governors Backs Limited Practice for Recent Law School Grads as They Await Bar Exam
news.description: In light of the likely cancellation of many July bar exams due to COVID-19, the ABA is urging states to permit limited practice with attorney supervision for new law school graduates.

news.title: Thinking Lean: Five Steps to a More Efficient Legal Practice
news.description: Tips for creating a more cost-effective law firm include choosing a process to fix, assessing stakeholder needs, and mapping the process to identify and eliminate inefficiencies.
